summary: Choriocarcinoma is a trophoblastic cancer, often originating in the placenta, characterized by early hematogenous spread to the lungs. It represents the malignant end of the spectrum in gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD) and can also be classified as a germ cell tumor, potentially arising in the testis or ovary.
symptoms: Testicular cancer (as a presentation in males)
diagnosis: Histopathological examination (identification of syncytiotrophoblasts and cytotrophoblasts without villi)
treatments: EMACO regimen (Etoposide, Methotrexate, Actinomycin D, Cyclophosphamide, Vincristine)
